00062    virtual void SetFocusRect(wxRect & r);
00063 
00064    virtual bool IsEnabled() const { return mEnabled; }
00065    virtual void Disable();
00066    virtual void Enable();
00067    void SetEnabled(bool state) {
00068       state ? Enable() : Disable();
00069    }
00070 
00071    virtual void PushDown();
00072    virtual void PopUp();
00073 
00074    virtual void OnErase(wxEraseEvent & event);

00076    virtual void OnSize(wxSizeEvent & event);

00082 
00083    virtual bool WasShiftDown(); // returns true if shift was held down
00084                                 // the last time the button was clicked
00085    virtual bool WasControlDown(); // returns true if control was held down
00086                                   // the last time the button was clicked
00087    bool IsDown(){ return mButtonIsDown;}
00088    void SetButtonToggles( bool toggler ){ mToggle = toggler;}
00089    void Toggle(){ mButtonIsDown ? PopUp() : PushDown();}
00090    void Click();
00091    void SetShift(bool shift);
00092 
00093    enum AButtonState {
00094       AButtonUp,
00095       AButtonOver,
00096       AButtonDown,
00097       AButtonDis
00098    };
00099 
00100    AButtonState GetState();
00101 
00102    void UseDisabledAsDownHiliteImage(bool flag);

00105 
00106    bool HasAlternateImages();

00109              wxWindowID id,
00110              const wxPoint & pos,
00111              const wxSize & size,
00112              ImageRoll up,
00113              ImageRoll over,
00114              ImageRoll down,
00115              ImageRoll dis,
00116              bool toggle);
00117 
00118    bool mAlternate;
00119    bool mToggle;   // This bool, if true, makes the button able to
00120                    // process events when it is in the down state, and
00121                    // moving to the opposite state when it is clicked.
00122                    // It is used for the Pause button, and possibly
00123                    // others.  If false, it (should) behave just like
00124                    // a standard button.
00125 
00126    bool mWasShiftDown;
00127    bool mWasControlDown;
00128 
00129    bool mCursorIsInWindow;
00130    bool mButtonIsFocused;
00131    bool mButtonIsDown;
00132    bool mIsClicking;
00133    bool mEnabled;
00134    bool mUseDisabledAsDownHiliteImage;
00135 
00136    ImageRoll mImage[4];
00137    ImageRoll mAltImage[4];
00138 
00139    wxRect mFocusRect;

00146 #if wxUSE_ACCESSIBILITY

00148 class AButtonAx: public wxWindowAccessible
00149 {
00150 public:
00151    AButtonAx(wxWindow * window);
00152 
00153    virtual ~ AButtonAx();
00154 
00155    // Performs the default action. childId is 0 (the action for this object)
00156    // or > 0 (the action for a child).
00157    // Return wxACC_NOT_SUPPORTED if there is no default action for this
00158    // window (e.g. an edit control).
00159    virtual wxAccStatus DoDefaultAction(int childId);
00160 
00161    // Retrieves the address of an IDispatch interface for the specified child.
00162    // All objects must support this property.
00163    virtual wxAccStatus GetChild( int childId, wxAccessible** child );
00164 
00165    // Gets the number of children.
00166    virtual wxAccStatus GetChildCount(int* childCount);
00167 
00168    // Gets the default action for this object (0) or > 0 (the action for a child).
00169    // Return wxACC_OK even if there is no action. actionName is the action, or the empty
00170    // string if there is no action.
00171    // The retrieved string describes the action that is performed on an object,
00172    // not what the object does as a result. For example, a toolbar button that prints
00173    // a document has a default action of "Press" rather than "Prints the current document."
00174    virtual wxAccStatus GetDefaultAction( int childId, wxString *actionName );
00175 
00176    // Returns the description for this object or a child.
00177    virtual wxAccStatus GetDescription( int childId, wxString *description );
00178 
00179    // Gets the window with the keyboard focus.
00180    // If childId is 0 and child is NULL, no object in
00181    // this subhierarchy has the focus.
00182    // If this object has the focus, child should be 'this'.
00183    virtual wxAccStatus GetFocus( int *childId, wxAccessible **child );
00184 
00185    // Returns help text for this object or a child, similar to tooltip text.
00186    virtual wxAccStatus GetHelpText( int childId, wxString *helpText );
00187 
00188    // Returns the keyboard shortcut for this object or child.
00189    // Return e.g. ALT+K
00190    virtual wxAccStatus GetKeyboardShortcut( int childId, wxString *shortcut );
00191 
00192    // Returns the rectangle for this object (id = 0) or a child element (id > 0).
00193    // rect is in screen coordinates.
00194    virtual wxAccStatus GetLocation( wxRect& rect, int elementId );
00195 
00196    // Gets the name of the specified object.
00197    virtual wxAccStatus GetName( int childId, wxString *name );
00198 
00199    // Returns a role constant.
00200    virtual wxAccStatus GetRole( int childId, wxAccRole *role );
00201 
00202    // Gets a variant representing the selected children
00203    // of this object.
00204    // Acceptable values:
00205    // - a null variant (IsNull() returns TRUE)
00206    // - a list variant (GetType() == wxT("list"))
00207    // - an integer representing the selected child element,
00208    //   or 0 if this object is selected (GetType() == wxT("long"))
00209    // - a "void*" pointer to a wxAccessible child object
00210    virtual wxAccStatus GetSelections( wxVariant *selections );
00211 
00212    // Returns a state constant.
00213    virtual wxAccStatus GetState(int childId, long* state);
00214 
00215    // Returns a localized string representing the value for the object
00216    // or child.
00217    virtual wxAccStatus GetValue(int childId, wxString* strValue);
00218 
00219 };
